title: Compound Tenses
goal: Learn to combine time tenses with aspect and duration.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

All 8 spatial positions:

inside → ?      outside → ?
above → ?       below → ?
front → ?       behind → ?
left → ?        right → ?

(Answers: nenri, bartu, gapru, cnita, crane, trixe, zunle, pritu)

New Material (5-7 min)

Building Compound Tenses

Combine tense (pu/ca/ba) with aspect (co'a/ca'o/mo'u/co'u) and duration (ze'i/ze'a/ze'u):

Time + Aspect

Compound Meaning
puca'o was ongoing
puco'a began (in the past)
pumo'u had completed
baco'a will begin
baca'o will be ongoing

Examples

mi puca'o citka

I was eating (ongoing in the past).

lo prenu cu puco'a cadzu

The person started walking (past).

mi baco'a cilre la .jbobau.

I will begin learning Lojban.

Time + Duration

Compound Meaning
puze'a for a while in the past
puze'u for a long time in the past
baze'i briefly in the future

Examples

mi puze'a gunka

I worked for a while (past).

mi baze'u stali

I will stay for a long time.

Key Point

Compound tenses combine time + aspect + duration for precise temporal meaning.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Time + Aspect

Translate:

  1. I was eating. (past + ongoing)
  2. The dog started running. (past + began)
  3. I will finish working. (future + completed)
Answers
  1. mi puca'o citka
  2. lo gerku cu puco'a bajra
  3. mi bamo'u gunka

Exercise 2: Time + Duration

Translate:

  1. I studied for a long time. (past + long)
  2. I will rest briefly. (future + brief)
  3. She talked for a while. (past + medium)
Answers
  1. mi puze'u tadni
  2. mi baze'i surla
  3. ri puze'a tavla

Exercise 3: Complex

Translate:

  1. I was sleeping for a long time.
  2. The rain will begin soon.
  3. We had finished eating.
Answers
  1. mi puze'u ca'o sipna or mi puca'o ze'u sipna
  2. lo carvi cu baco'a
  3. mi'o pumo'u citka

items.text: I studied for a long time. (past + long)
She talked for a while. (past + medium)
I was sleeping for a long time.
items.answer: `mi puze'u ca'o sipna` or `mi puca'o ze'u sipna`

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I was working." → mi puca'o gunka
  2. "I will begin." → mi baco'a
  3. "I studied for a long time." → mi puze'u tadni

Today's Grammar

Compound tenses:

Pattern Example Meaning
pu + ca'o puca'o was ongoing
ba + co'a baco'a will begin
pu + ze'u puze'u for long (past)

Summary

You learned to combine time tenses with aspect and duration markers for precise temporal expressions.
